sections.heading: Overview
content:
Mary Lou Ballweg is president and executive director of the Endometriosis
Association, an organization she helped found in 1980. Besides founding and
leading the association for the last 20 years, she has overseen publication of
the association's two books, educational videotapes, and an extensive body of
literature on endometriosis. She has also overseen the development and
execution of a $1.3 million educational awareness campaign and two public
service announcement campaigns, as well as numerous other outreach efforts.

Ballweg helped found the world's first research registry for endometriosis
and was responsible for a major breakthrough in endometriosis research, which
linked the condition to dioxin. The breakthrough received attention in leading
scientific journals, prompting numerous additional research studies.

Ballweg was instrumental in establishing a research program for
endometriosis at Dartmouth Medical School and Vanderbilt University School of
Medicine.
